column5: how did i miss this report?? ....  Congrats on the PB Carole! That sure sounds like an amazing day to me! Great report and pic Cliff
Great Report. Some nice bass and some even nicer Musky! Congrats to Bly on her PB.
Man o man, you can't beat a day like that, WTG to the both of ya's...
Certainly a day to remember! Great stuff.
Nice fish, Congrats on the pb.
another great day on the water for sure.......
Wow!  Nice job on the muskies.  I just want to catch one and you manage like 15 in a day.  Congrats on the PB
Sooooo... did you weigh any of those fish?
LOL....Funny you mention that Glen...we didn't weigh any of them.  We did the length just to see if any qualified for OFAH.
Awesome day out...simply awesome
Awesome reports as always  Sounds like a fantastic day on Sturgeon.  Congrats on your first Ski Bly!
Ah another fine report enjoyed that Cliff .Love the part about getting wifey sprayed by boat wake.He He.  Can't wait to have a day like that one
Well done my friends! Is it safe to assume you've caught the Musky bug?

that's a great way to get into your first musky...kick some butt and catch a couple of them  , gotta love it when they jump..really gets the blood pumping, sounds like you 2 shared a great day on the water

It sounds like the best day in the whole world.  Quality time together laughing and enjoying one another, fish and some friends... PERFECT!!!  You guys truly rock!  Way to GO!  Cheers,  Jen  p.s. I love your posts
Well done guys!
Great day on the water and a nice report.  Be careful with your reports or you'll have tons of fishermen following you everytime you leave your driveway pulling the boat.

After spending last week up on Sturgeon at a cottage we rented I think it is now my favoutite Kawartha lake. We caught everything that swims in that lake in abundance even got a couple muskies in the brief time the kids weren't in the boat, actually my buddy got a 40" fish with the little ones there and it was interesting trying to manage the fish with 6 of us in the boat.. congrats on a great outing. I will post my report soon.

Nice job on the shoal carp you two...  Cph managed a 20 pounder of the common type today but I am now 0 for the past  5 trips...  Might have to invest in a bow and arrow for when they come into the shoreline to feed on the corn we put out for the ducks...saw five at once around 10:00 AM...
Great fish!  That will be a memorable day for many years!

I hear you Jason!  I'll call you to set something up!    Interesting Rich....never heard of that before!  Yeah...it was a great fight!    Not sure if we have the bug yet, but they sure are fun to catch!    Jen...we were saying even before the muskies that it was just a great day...lots of laughs, no agenda for the day....just having fun and relaxing.  The muskies were just a bonus to an already perfect day.    Follow us?? LOL.  One great day on the water....probably just a fluke...
Congrats to the both of you!!! Sturgeon has some real nice fish. Thanks for the report.  Cheers, 1leg
Well that sure beats kicking around the house and nursing a sore back! Congrats to you both!!!
WTG !!!  Gotta love it when a plan comes together !!!!!  Nice fish !  Meely
great trip cliff what a day on the water ski's and bass congrats
Amazing catches C&C.  I totally love the markings on the muskies. Catching a muskie is definitely on my life's to-do list.  Congrats on the PB!
Congrats on the magical day.

Bly and I decided last night that we'd hit a Kawartha Lake bright and early this morning.  We didn't decide on the lake until just before we went to bed.  The plan....wake up at 5am, out the door by 530am and then on the water on Sturgeon Lake by 7am.  All went according to plan.  As we arrived at the lake, we passed by Big Cliff's place and saw him working, so we stopped for a few minutes to say hi.  I'm glad we did, because he told us where to look for the fish, and what colours were working lately!!  We launched and were on the water by 7am.  Not long after, using a brown worm rigged texas style, I caught the first fish of the day.   The drift was ideal, so I kept on catching fish!  Bly on the other hand was having some issues until a little later on.  Here's a few of the bass that were caught.....         Bly finally hooks into one...her first of the day.....here she is fighting the fish....   And here's her beauty 17" Smallie!   The bite slowed down around 11am....so she took the opportunity to work on her tan....   Bly also landed a small walleye, but we didn't care....we were having a blast out there....something we needed!  At one point, while motoring back to start a drift again, she's picking weeds off her lure....she throws it in the water...only it hits me square in the face!!  We're laughing out heads off, but I got even.  She lies back down on the front bench to relax.  A large boat crosses in front of us, so I speed up just enough to soak her as we hit their wake....hehe.  At around noon we headed to Big Cliff's dock to drop in and say hi.  We chatted with Cliff and Sue for a while and caught up a little.  Big Cliff then asked where we planned on fishing for the afternoon and I told him that I spied a spot on the GPS that marked water in the 20 to 25 foot range...thinking that they'd head deeper as the day wore on.  He suggested trying deep weeds in the 5 to 8 foot range instead, so that's where we headed....and boy are we glad we did!!!!  We got to the general area and fished for bass for a bit...then we noticed all kinds of cabbage and grass.....we looked at eachother and put on bucktails instead.  About 10 minutes later, Bly says that she thinks she had a hit.....then as she's retrieving, a HUGE muskie is following it!!  Ok...we are no longer fishing for Bass.....LOL.  We end the drift and decide to troll back up to where we started.  As we're trolling, Bly yells out "FISH ON!!".  This thing jumps clear out of the water and begins running away from us.  She looks at her spool....it's half empty!  I start up the motor and chase after it.  As we get closer it clears the water yet again.  As it hits the water it begins a run straight at us.  She's reeling like mad and I begin to back troll to help out....while doing this it jumps yet again.  She's finally getting better control of the fish and when it's boatside, it jumps so high it clears our gunwhale.  Finally....her first ever and new PB muskie is landed....a beauty 33" one.   Here's a shot of it's head....lotsa sharp teeth!!!   Back it goes into the water and I spy a patch of cabbage off to the side.  I cast over and as soon as my lure hits the water I feel a hit!!  I land this 31" muskie....   Bly has been trying in vain since last summer to catch her muskie and now that she's landed one, she decides to show off....and lands this beauty as well!  This one also was quite acrobatic!  This one measured in at 32".....   We decided it was about time to leave and she says....hold on....there's some more cabbage over there.  She yells "Last cast!!!" and don't you know it, she get another one.   Anyhow, this marked our BEST day on the water ever.  Bly completed the Kawartha Trifecta (Bass, Walleye, Muskie) and we both had a heck of a lot of fun out there.  We headed in to tell Big Cliff and Sue about our afternoon and then trailered the boat and headed home.  Thanks for reading this novel of a report....haha.
Holy Crap on a Crutch!!! Excellent report and pics!!!  Beauty fish too!!!  Looks like y'all are really getting the hang of boat fishin' now, that's great!!!  Congrats to Miss Bly on her PB!!!
Great report and pictures.  Looks like you sure got into them.  Congrats to Bly on her first Muskie.
Congrats SIS and Cliff . What a great day.  Magic days don't happen that often but when they do it is wonderful
Eee doggies Bly and Cliff! That was some day you both had.â™
what an awesome day guys!  You're one lucky couple to have each other!  Cheers, UF  ps. I think Bly's 17 inch smallie is actually a largie...or a smallie with a GIANT mouth! hehe
I'm with Urban, that's a largie alright. Congrats on the multiple musky day. I bet now your boat smells just right  .

What an awesome day!  I was thinking of hitting Sturgeon for a few hours tonight ... after a full day on Sparrow... haha.  Bly's 17 inch smallie, is actually a 17 inch largie. Great Day out guys, good job!
Nice report and congrats on Bly's PB, Looks like your Largie pattern paid off cliff.
Great reports folks and congrats on such a great day.
great day on the lake!
Thanks for the correction....largie it is.  Thought because of the horizontal line (or lack of one) that it was a smallie.  And, thanks all for your comments....was an amazing day out there!
Right ON!!  Pic number 3 looks like a smallie.. You can tell from the eyes..  Well done ol boy.  Nice looking lunges there!  cheers HD
those are the days that make up for the slow ones.nice work guys.
That is a great day on the water congrats to Bly on her PB  Rob
Woohoo, congrats to both of you.  Can feel the fun you had tough the post.  Thanks for sharing/
WOW.... that was an amazing trip for sure.....congrats on the bass and muskies.... Were gonna have to hook up for an evening real soon (just got back yesterday).  Thanks for sharing  Jason
Nice bunch of fish! Thanks for sharing.
Alright!
Now that's a good fishin story   With lots of nice fish to boot
The bass looks like a "mean-mouth" aka smallie/largie cross breed. Bet it fought like crazy too!  Congrats on the awesome day!
awesome job guys!
Great report and pics ccmt  You guys sure had a blast catching a good mix bag of fish!  Congrats to bly on her PB    Real beautiful skis  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Sweet mother of pearl, that is a fantastic day on the water.  Congrats Carole, you go girl!!!!!!!  Love the weeds in the face trick, I'll have to try that, he he he.  Joey
NICELY DONE GUYS!!! BEAUTY FISH AND CONGRAT ON PB BLY
